Vata.preparation: Warm oil gently, mix turmeric, and massage affected area for 10–15 mins.
Vata.description: Warming and lubricating — relieves Vata stiffness, dryness, and joint cracking.

Pitta.preparation: Blend all ingredients, apply thin layer on sore area for 15 minutes.
Pitta.description: Cooling and anti-inflammatory — calms Pitta heat, redness, and swelling.

Kapha.preparation: Warm herbs in dry pan, wrap in cloth, and apply compress to area for 10 mins.
Kapha.description: Stimulating and detoxifying — reduces Kapha stiffness and water retention.
contraindications: Pregnancy: avoid hot compress on abdomen

title: Fever with chills and body ache

Vata.preparation: Boil tulsi and ginger in 2 cups of water for 10 minutes, strain, and add honey when warm.
Vata.description: Warming and restorative — supports Vata recovery, improves circulation, and reduces chills.

Pitta.preparation: Steep ingredients in warm water, cool, and sip slowly.
Pitta.description: Cooling and soothing — reduces Pitta heat, burning, and feverish inflammation.

Kapha.preparation: Boil herbs for 7 minutes, strain, and add honey when warm.
Kapha.description: Decongestant and detoxifying — breaks Kapha stagnation and boosts immunity.
Kapha.frequency_duration: 2x daily during cold or flu for 5–7 days

Pitta.preparation: Soak coriander and rose overnight, strain, and drink cool in morning.
Pitta.description: Cooling and soothing — calms Pitta heat, BP spikes, and irritability.

Kapha.preparation: Mix all in warm water and sip slowly on empty stomach.
Kapha.description: Warming and circulation-boosting — clears Kapha stagnation and cholesterol buildup.

Vata.preparation: Use fresh/ground herbs to make a warm decoction. Simmer 5-10 minutes, strain, and take warm. Adjust herbs for condition-specific notes.
Vata.description: Warming, grounding, and lubricating — calms Vata's coldness or dryness and supports circulation.
contraindications: pregnancy: consult before concentrated herb use
Vata.frequency_duration: 1–3x daily for 3–14 days depending on severity

Vata.preparation: Warm ghee slightly and apply around eyes. Optionally add a drop of rose water over eyelids (not inside).
Vata.description: Lubricating and grounding — relieves Vata dryness, twitching, and light sensitivity.
contraindications: Allergy to dairy: use almond oil externally

Pitta.preparation: Soak cotton pads in rose water, place on closed eyes for 10–15 minutes with cucumber slices.
Pitta.description: Cooling and soothing — pacifies Pitta heat, redness, and burning.
contraindications: Cold-sensitive individuals: use slightly cool compress

Kapha.preparation: Boil Triphala powder in water, cool and strain thoroughly; use as external rinse or eye splash.
Kapha.description: Detoxifying and clearing — reduces Kapha heaviness, puffiness, and dullness in eyes.
contraindications: Avoid during infection or eye surgery recovery
Kapha.frequency_duration: 1x daily in morning for up to 7 days

Vata.preparation: Warm sesame oil slightly. Mix with a little aloe gel and apply over affected area or scalp.
Vata.description: Moisturizing and grounding — soothes Vata dryness, flakiness, and brittleness.
Vata.frequency_duration: Apply 1x daily or alternate days for 10–14 days

Pitta.preparation: Mix sandalwood with rose water and aloe gel into a smooth paste. Apply for 15 minutes and rinse.
Pitta.description: Cooling and calming — pacifies Pitta inflammation, acne, and heat-related redness.

Kapha.preparation: Boil neem and tulsi in water for 10 minutes, cool, strain, and use as rinse or face splash.
Kapha.description: Detoxifying and clarifying — clears Kapha oiliness, dandruff, and clogged pores.
